channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Macy’s, Dillard’s, and Nordstrom are getting their groove back
item.description: Department stores have a new playbook to win back shoppers from discount stores and Amazon.

item.title: Elon Musk’s $1 trillion pay package and the race to the bottom among states with weak corporate governance laws
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Gen Alpha won’t ever have to write an email when they join the workforce, new research reveals—they’ll be sending voice notes to their boss instead
item.description: LSE researchers say Gen Alpha will talk, not type at work—they predict that voice notes will make keyboard practically obsolete by 2030.

item.title: Even as stocks slide, Wall Street is at ‘historically extreme valuations,’ warns Apollo chief economist
item.description: The latest data underlines a broader concern among analysts that a reckoning is looming for the markets.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg says ‘The Social Network’ nailed his wardrobe: ‘Every single shirt or fleece they had in that movie is a shirt or fleece that I own’
item.description: Zuckerberg even bought one of the shirts worn by actor Jesse Eisenberg, on auction, for over $4,000.

item.title: FAA cuts may snarl airports this weekend. What to do if you have to travel.
The SALT deduction is going up to $40,000. Here’s how to get the most out of it.
Nancy Pelosi to retire in 2027. Here’s the retirement package she may get.
Tesla's stock rises as shareholders approve Elon Musk’s $1 trillion pay package
Why one firm’s report on the jobs market contributed to Thursday’s stock selloff
